intro: Capsicum richardii, commonly known as the red capsicum or chili pepper, is a species native to South America. It is characterized by its small to medium-sized fruits, which are typically red when mature. The plant is a herbaceous shrub with hairy stems and lobed leaves. Its flowers are yellow and bilaterally symmetrical, typical of the Solanaceae family. The fruit contains numerous seeds enclosed in a fleshy, aromatic pulp.
